qas.question: When were albums as we currently know them widely released?
What is typically found on the front cover of an album?
How may records were commonly found in an album?
When did the vinyl LP records Era begin?
How many songs did most albums contain?

context: In the <a0_0>1930s<a0_0/>, record companies began issuing collections of 78 rpm records by one performer or of one type of music in specially assembled albums, typically with <a1_0>artwork<a1_0/> on the front cover and liner notes on the back or inside cover. Most albums included <a2_0>three or four<a2_0/> records, with two sides each, making <a4_0>six or eight<a4_0/> tunes per album. When the 12-inch vinyl LP era began in <a3_0>1949<a3_0/>, the single record often had the same or similar number of tunes as a typical album of 78s, and was still often referred to as an "album".
